resources.string: 1. The image above was created by using a simple m * n two-dimensional array, where the value at each index, 1 or 0, determines the color of the pixel at that index in the image. What is the minimum possible value of m + n?
2. If you start with an empty stack, what will the stack look like after the following operations have been applied? (left->right)\npush(7); push(8); pop(); push(pop()*3); \npush(40); push(pop()/2);

3. Suppose that you have an unsorted array of 1000 emails and you want to check if abc123@gmail.com is in the array. Using a naive algorithm where you move sequentially through the list checking if each element matches abc123@gmail.com, what is the maximum number of comparisons you would need to make?
4. In general, what are the advantages of a red-black tree over a standard binary search tree?

5. Suppose you wanted to write a navigation algorithm via a breadth-first approach. Given a series of roads with intersections, your initial position, and your destination, what would the intersections represent?
B. It has faster insertion and deletion times
C. It has a faster look-up time
D. It can store more data in its leaves
